FuncDef:
The pim hello-option holdtime command sets the neighbor timeout period carried in PIM Hello packets to be sent by a PIM interface.
The undo pim hello-option holdtime command restores the default value.
y default, the neighbor timeout period carried in PIM Hello packets to be sent by a PIM interface is 105 seconds.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the neighbor timeout period carried in PIM Hello messages to be sent.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 65535, in seconds.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
You can run this command to set the neighbor timeout period carried in PIM Hello packets to be sent by a router. If the receive end does not receive any Hello packet from the local device within the timeout period, the receive end considers that the local neighbor is aged. If you want a router to quickly sense the changes of PIM neighbors, set a smaller value for the interval parameter, but the interval value is larger than the interval at which PIM neighbors send Hello messages.
Prerequisites
The multicast routing function has been enabled using the multicast routing-enable command in the public network instance view or VPN instance view.
Configuration Impact
If the pim hello-option holdtime command is run more than once, the latest configuration overrides the previous one.
